text: <@U026AP8CM> I think <@U02613K0X> brings up a good point. Are we building this so the client can add more categories or are we hardcoding the ones from the comps?
I can confirm at 1030 I am calling them
Cool. I'll send you a list of open questions in case you have time to ask them.

<@U026AP8CM> I think we should steer toward hardcoding them. It’s one fewer thing we have to manage in the CMS and we won’t have to worry about what the desktop version looks like if they add/remove/change categories and descriptions
and it would be more work for me to add that capability to the CMS now than to manually go in and change them a few times in the future
ok, will steer them toward that <@U02613K0X>
thanks for the info!
<@U02618EV1>: that approach easier you for vs. allowing mullen to change categories?
I'm with <@U02613K0X> on this. The only thing is that they will need us to change the code every time a category changes or gets added.
<@U0289USNA> and <@U02613K0X> looks like they want us to use the same functionality for "Add to Calendar." <http://www.smallbatchws.com/events/#.U6sB3o1dXSI>

attachments.title: Small Batch Beer Co. Events Calendar
attachments.text: Small Batch Beer Co. calendar of events.
attachments.fallback: Small Batch Beer Co.: Small Batch Beer Co. Events Calendar

text: Looks like they're using this service to generate the links <http://addthisevent.com/>
Is that something the we can add to the CMS?

Also, <@U026AP8CM> two things: 1. It seems like they have to enter the events separately on both their current CMS and this service? Can we confirm that? 2. Looks like we need a license # to use this service. Can we request that from the client?
of course
will confirm
thanks for bringing this up.
<@U02618EV1> what would we need to add to the CMS for this? Looks from their docs like you just include their script and some formatted html on the front end to generate the links.
i agree we need their license so we can display the links however we want, but it looks like we can just use the data entered about each event in the CMS to generate the necessary html
no need to register each event with the AddThisEvent service
True.
